poem:
**The Exchange**

In the day room's hush,  
a magazine offered—  
pages binding hearts,  
or perhaps unlocking  
them; choice paints  
its quiet hues  
on the canvas of  
a summer sun.  
Here, between rows  
of printed lines,  
the world tilts,  
dancing on edges  
of trust  
and unspoken  
whispers.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "She was a prison officer. He was a convicted rapist. How did she fall for him? There was a moment in the summer of 2022 when 26-year-old Cherrie-Ann Austin-Saddington, a female prison officer in a men’s jail, had to make a choice. She was on her wing at HMP The Verne in Dorset, in the day room where inmates go to read books and newspapers, when a prisoner called Bradley Trengrove handed her a magazine.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: She was a prison officer. He was a convicted rapist. How did she fall for him? There was a moment in the summer of 2022 when 26-year-old Cherrie-Ann Austin-Saddington, a female prison officer in a men’s jail, had to make a choice. She was on her wing at HMP The Verne in Dorset, in the day room where inmates go to read books and newspapers, when a prisoner called Bradley Trengrove handed her a magazine.
